entry.title: Remove useless ordering
entry.content:
Remove useless ORDER BY sql operator. Result of SELECT statement is

inserted into std::map with id used as key

so ordering by start_time is not used and only slows SELECT. Speed-up

is more noticeable in profiles with thousands of downloads.



Change-Id: I67c55a50f91d1b8b8ebe25a325dab0f1a578d9dd

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4642388

Reviewed-by: Scott Violet

Commit-Queue: Alexander Yashkin

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1162072}

entry.title: arc: Set up unit test for arc_volume_mounter_bridge
entry.content:
This CL sets up the test environment for ArcVolumeMounterBridgeTest by

introducing fake classes and adding the necessary setup / teardown logic

that are necessary for implementing very basic test cases. Also adds a

test case for ArcVolumeMounterBridge::OnMountEvent, but more test cases

needs to be added in follow-up CLs.



BUG=b:184675038

TEST=ash_components_unittests \

TEST= --gtest_filter="ArcVolumeMounterBridgeTest.*"



Change-Id: I9ecbd55f710eb5701483bf3f963ed714af859a0c

entry.title: media/gpu/v4l2: Remove V4L2Device::Create()
entry.content:
Since now V4L2Device creation cannot fail (see the Create() body

now), there's no need for a factory method; removing it simplifies

callsites since they don't need to verify that the created device

is not nullptr.



Bug: b:275718462

Change-Id: Id8522889093634726400ed91ff849a92c6a18a67

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4621629

Commit-Queue: Miguel Casas-Sanchez

Reviewed-by: Steve Cho

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1162058}

entry.title: [User Ed, Test Automation] Allow activate, event, hide in any context
entry.content:
This CL adds ElementTracker support for the following subscriptions:

- Activated in any context

- Custom event in any context

- Hidden in any context



It adds support for ContextMode::kAny for all event types.

- Care is taken to avoid adding an in-any-context step that could add

a listener for the same event it is responding to that could be

triggered when the "in any context" events are sent out.



It also updates documentation and adds tests to ensure that

InteractiveTest InAnyContext() supports all step types except

EnsureNotPresent().



The net effect is that you can now do something like:

PressButton(kHideOtherWindowButtonElementId),

InAnyContext(WaitForHide(kOtherWindowElementId))



Future work may be warranted to solve the issues with consecutive

near-identical steps (very low-priority) and EnsureNotPresent (which

will be higher priority now as it's the only exception).



Bug: 1457375

entry.title: wallpaper: race condition in setting default ToD wallpaper
entry.content:
During OOBE flow, it's possible that the synced wallpaper info is not

available after the user active pref service becomes active. In this

case, the ToD wallpaper is set as the default wallpaper and prevents the

user's existing wallpaper to be synced in. To address this race

condition, we check for additional information about oobe state to

determine whether we should honor the synced wallpaper.



BUG=b/288284193

TEST=ash_unittests --gtest_filter="WallpaperControllerTest.*"

entry.title: lacros: fix the buffer scale when setting wayland cursor
entry.content:
Cursor in lacros is oversize because the buffer scale is not

set correctly because surface_submission_in_pixel_coordinates

was never meant to be used for cursor and lacros should just

use the standard wayland cursor protocol. Wayland cursor does

not submit surface in pixel coordinates as only AuraToplevel and

AuraPopup implement SetClientSubmitsSurfacesInPixelCoordinates.

Thus we still need to set buffer scale explicitly.



Also `WebCursor::GetNativeCursor` scale the cursor from

its image scale factor to device scale factor. Because device

scale factor is not always integer (e.g. 2.08) and wayland set

buffer scale can only accept integer, there might be rounding

error and cause wrong bitmap size when calculating the logical

pixel bitmap in ash. The solution is to keep image scale factor

which should be integer so that there won't be rounding error.



This approach can also fix mis-scaled cursor with multi-display

(i.e. when moving a lacros window from a 1x display to a 2x display,

the cursor scale is wrong in 2x) because we don't do any scaling in

lacros anymore.



Bug: 1450385, 1450388, 1440148, b/285205466

Change-Id: I4498cd01c5c13bba0436f14226929144bd641d9c

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4583534

Reviewed-by: Mike Wasserman

entry.title: cros_next: add a background blur shield component
entry.content:
Some UI components may need to enable background blur. However,

when the UI has rounded corners, applying the rounded corners to

its layer will clip the contents of the view and its children,

for example the focus ring. In this case, we should paint the

background on an independent layer and set it below the view.



This cl adds a new components called BlurredBackgroundShield which

holds a rounded rect solid color background layer. It will set the

layer under the view and update the background color on theme

changed when a dynamic color token is set.



The component is tested in the style viewer. Will add unit tests

in following CLs.



Bug: b:277915834

entry.title: Lacros: Remove the backward compatibility code for ash keeplist.
entry.content:
Ash extension keeplist data is configured in Ash and passed to

Lacros via crosapi::mojom::BrowserInitParams starting from M109.

Before that, the Ash keeplist configuration data was compiled in

both Ash and Lacros binaries, and we've kept the code for exposing

extension keeplist configuration data in Lacros to support the old

Ash (prior M109). Now that we have already passed the milestones for Lacros to support the old Ash, we are cleaning up the backward compatibility code in Lacros in this cl.



Some browser tests and unit tests in Lacros running without

Ash could not get the Ash keeplist data from Ash via

crosapi::mojom::BrowserInitParams, therefore, I added a test

helper function to allow these tests to get an empty ash keeplist

data to proceed without hit CHECK failure due to the absence of

ash keeplist in crosapi::mojom::BrowserInitParams.



Bug: 1371661

entry.title: multi_display: Update restore bounds on root window changes
entry.content:
Updates the restore bounds property and restore bounds inside the

history stack to be inside the new root window while the window

being moved to another display. Note, do not update them if the

window is set to be fullscreen-ed in another display on purpose,

as the window is expected to be restored back to the previous

display in this case.



This will resolve the issue that windows suddenly jump from one

display to another. Also the issue that windows are almost offscreen

while being moved to another display.

entry.title: ipcz: Reduce memory footprint
entry.content:
This change trims the memory footprint of portals in a number of

ways.



(NOTE: All sizes here refer to 64-bit builds)



Size of Portal+Router before: 1952 bytes

Size of Portal+Router after: 472 bytes



Total savings of 1480 bytes per pipe endpoint, so likely tens of

megabytes in common desktop scenarios.



Stuff trimmed:



- ParcelQueue and SequencedQueue are now templated over inline storage

size. Router's inbound ParcelQueue now has only 1 element of inline

storage (down from 4) and its outbound queue now has 0 (also down

from 4). (-936 bytes)

- Moves Portal's and Router's PendingTransactionSets to the heap

since they're often unused. (-120x2 = -240 bytes)

- TrapSet (which Router inlines) now only retains a single element

of inlined storage. (-144 bytes)

- Router layout optimized for better packing (-16 bytes)

- Router's IpczPortalStatus replaced with only flags, which pack

well with other fields. TrapSet already retains a status struct

so this was redundant. (-32 bytes)

- The optional inward RouteEdge is now on heap since it's usually

null (-56 bytes)

- RouteEdge itself (outward edge is inlined in Router) has all its

decaying state moved to the heap since it's usually null

(-40 bytes)

- Remove unused Node ref from Portal (-8 bytes)

- Remove unnecessary Mutex from Portal. We don't need to synchronize

on callers' behalf. (-8 bytes)



Opportunistically this also removes some dead code: Parcel::Consume()

never consumes data anymore and so is now Parcel::ConsumeHandles();

and Parcel::SetInlinedData() was no longer being called and is now removed.



Bug: 1447541

Change-Id: I3b484a7ec6628974f7e96ea0a0b3362709b0d91f

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4633916

Reviewed-by: Alex Gough

entry.title: Improve ExpandRectForPixelMovement()
entry.content:
Make FilterOperations::ExpandRectForPixelMovement() use MapRect()

internally. MapRect() exists to expand rects for filters when drawing

them so it can be reused to expand rects for filters in damage

calculations as well.



This can result in the expanded rect being larger in some cases where it

was too small before. MapRect() can handle arbitrary combinations of

filters where FilterOperations::MaxPixelMovement() only returned the

largest pixel movement for any individual filter. This can also result

in expansion being smaller when:



1. There is non-uniform pixel movement, eg. drop shadow.

2. The result was wrong before, eg. zoom filter, which doesn't move

pixels outside of the source rect.

3. The result was a place holder, eg. reference filter, which just

expanded the source rect by 100 pixels in all directions.



Bug: 1444408

entry.title: Posix StackDumpSignalHandler should re-raise signal
entry.content:
In-process stack dumping has caused problems on Posix platforms

due to the signal handler's behavior. Historically on some platforms

it has just called _exit(1) which is bad for tests that need to verify

a process crashed with the correct signal (e.g. sandbox tests,

crash reporter tests, assertion tests, MTE tests). More recently it

has been returning from the signal handler and waiting for the crash

to occur again, which may not re-raise the signal if the signal was

delivered asynchronously (e.g. via kill(), or async MTE faults), or

possibly due to race condition crashes.



StackDumpSignalHandler() should instead just purposely re-raise

the signal, very similarly to crashpad.



On Linux, ChromeOS, and Android we try to use rt_tgsigqueueinfo to

re-raise the signal and preserve 100% of the crashing context. On

other Posix platforms (Mac) and very old, unsupported Linux kernels,

we just call raise() again which will preserve most of the important

context of the crashing instruction.



This effectively reverts

b54981c43da005a2a9bc115a23aadf83d5179079

e5c3e3c66c27f58f1ede8f6567862d762dfe2352



Bug: 551681

entry.title: Support PipeWire audio on more systems
entry.content:
First, support is added for using pipewire-media-session on systems that

haven't yet been migrated to WirePlumber. While pipewire-media-session

is effectively deprecated, it is still the only session manager on

enough systems to be worth supporting.



Second, the script now calls the pipewire binary directly to launch the

PulseAudio compatibility layer instead of via the pipewire-pulse

symlink. Support for the PulseAudio protocol is built into PipeWire, but

Debian has a separate package to install the pipewire-pulse symlink,

config file, user service, and documentation. Since CRD doesn't use the

user service and provides its own config file, bypassing the symlink

allows PipeWire audio forwarding to work even on systems without the

pipewire-pulse package installed.

entry.title: Add metrics to FLEDGE Latency UKM on ScoreAd and its dependencies.
entry.content:
IMPORTANT: This has one significant side effect on PrivateAggregationTimings! script_run_time and signals_fetch_time are recorded in InterestGroupAuction::OnScoreAdComplete(); prior to this change, a zero time is recorded for both of these when the script encounters an error, i.e. when SellerWorklet::V8State::PostScoreAdCallbackToUserThreadOnError was called; after this change, the actual script/signal-load times are recorded instead. This is because the same fields (scoring_latency and score_ad_dependency_latencies) are used for both PA Timings and the UKM metric.



Beyond that, the rest of this change is strictly the addition of new UKM metrics to the AdsInterestGroup.AuctionLatency.V2 event. In previous commits, reviewed as

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4359997 and

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4386873, we

added metrics for the latency of GenerateBid and its surrounding flow,

including metrics around delays caused by high-latency inputs to

GenerateBid. This commit adds the analogous metrics for ScoreAd and its

high-latency inputs.



As with those earlier commits, this adds several metrics:



1. ScoreAdFlowLatency reflects the latency of the entire ScoreAd flow,

from InterestGroupAuction::ScoreBidIfReady to

InterestGroupAuction::OnScoreAdComplete.



2. ScoreAdLatency reflects the latency of only the call to

V8State::ScoreAd, a component of the flow reflected in (1).



3. ScoreAdCodeReadyLatency, ScoreAdDirectFromSellerSignalsLatency, and

ScoreAdTrustedScoringSignalsLatency metrics reflect the latency and

critical path latency (delay) of each of these dependencies that must

be satisfied before V8State::ScoreAd can run.



Bug: 1424365

Change-Id: I1aaaa336991d818d142ba5e93ec9024d5ac053a3

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4584089

Reviewed-by: Maks Orlovich

entry.title: IndexedDB: create a key serialization that makes use of sentinels
entry.content:
For LevelDB, Chrome provides CompareEncodedIDBKeys (along with a host of

other comparators) in order to facilitate sorting keys by leveldb.

The IDB keys are serialized using length bytes, e.g. to specify the

length of an array, string, or blob, so we need to deserialize to some

extent before comparing.



Since we intend to store the serialized IDB keys as SQLite blobs, the

ordering comparator will be memcmp[1] and we need the serialized values

to be opaquely comparable. This patch introduces a serialization format

that uses sentinel values instead of up-front length bytes, and makes

sure each data type payload (e.g. double) sorts appropriately according

to memcmp.



For now, strings and binary data are stored in the simplest way

possible, which is by alternating data bytes and meta bytes, where a

meta byte of 0x01 indicates "continue" and a meta byte of 0x00 indicates

"terminate". Thus, a binary stream of 0x1234ABCDEF becomes:



0x01 0x12 0x01 0x34 0x01 0xAB 0x01 0xCD 0x01 0xEF 0x00



Strings are similar, although they use 2-byte characters and 2-byte meta

characters.



This should provide a decent starting point for experimentation which

can be optimized down the line (before any kind of actual launch).



[1] https://www.sqlite.org/datatype3.html#collation

entry.title: Clean up ToTimeT a little.
entry.content:
This modernizes ToTimeT to use saturated_cast since the Time

and TimeDelta values already do clamped math. It makes use of

InSecondsFloored because Unix time values do not go to the next

second until you are at or past the next second (not partway to it

from the previous one). This only matters for comparing times

before the epoch (and even then is really nitpicking)



There seems to be an 11 year old test that was very strange related to

time_t limits. This test depended on behaviour that assumed that base::time had a larger range than time_t, and only for #if APPLE - It also checks only the max and not the min values. and seems to have been driving the retaining of the strange limit check I removed from

ToTimeT just to make this test pass. Apple long ago moved on from

32 bit time_t values (Sadly, Linux and glibc are a different story).



I've reworked this test to test what I believe the correct limits

should be on both 32 and 64 bit time_t values, removed the APPLE

only check to run it everywhere, and ensure that it still tests

that infinite time values always map to the max and min time_t

values no matter what the size of the time_t is.



Change-Id: I92bb1d90e076fe45f9842e4ecd4ec762a9f1f504

entry.title: [color] Add prefs for the BrowserColorVariant to ThemeService
entry.content:
These prefs will be used to allow users to configure the

color_variant pref used to control the color variant used by

material-color-utilities for ChromeRefresh2023.



This enum is scoped to the ThemeService and must be explicitly

numbered to ensure values remain consistent between sessions.



This enum differs slightly to ColorProviderKey::SchemeVariant in

that it adds the kSystem value. This is necessary as a sentinel

value because the pref system does not have a way of storing optional

preferences.



Adding a kSystem value to ColorProviderKey::SchemeVariant does not

make sense either as it is intended to explicitly cover all possible

variant strategies, and kSystem would be meaningless in this context.

entry.title: [infra] Remove the need to use $mixin_append.
entry.content:
The $mixin_append field is used for appending rather than overwriting

any of the various *args fields or the named_caches field of the

swarming field, but there are no uses of the *args fields that are not

in $mixin_append and none of the non-$mixin_append occurrences of

named_caches is overwriting any other value. This simplifies the

behavior so that named_caches and *args fields will always be appended

rather than requiring the $mixin_append field. Once all mixins.pyl files

are updated, the $mixin_append handling can be removed.

entry.title: Check for context loss during drawing buffer resolution.
entry.content:
On dual-GPU MacBook Pros on top of OpenGL, when the system activates

the discrete GPU, the WebGL context must be lost and restored in

certain situations to avoid corruption of multisampled renderbuffers.



This context loss occurs in unexpected places, in particular during

execution of the ScopedDrawingBufferBinder. Check for it and early-out

in more places. Add a regression test which catches the bug.

entry.title: Reland "[BRP] Work around macOS 13 alignment issue differently"
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit 589e61c48e0bd0cf05cb037c6c06984611e91f26

It was reverted in crrev.com/c/4604755 (crbug.com/1453979).

The original code is in PS1. Further PSs implement a fix proposed by

tasak@ in crrev.com/c/4624474.



Original change's description:

> [BRP] Work around macOS 13 alignment issue differently

>

> This piggybacks on the "reserve more extras than PartitionRefCount"

> mechanism, introduced in crrev.com/c/4520247. It allows us to

> specifically target macOS 13, thus not burdening other OS versions with

> higher memory carveout.

>

> NOTE: incompatible with BackupRefPtrRefCountSize::k4B feature param

>

> Bug: 1378822

> Change-Id: I46d270aba75310431a1e68d3f82f9bd93e70e3f5

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4546959

> Auto-Submit: Bartek Nowierski

> Reviewed-by: Keishi Hattori

> Commit-Queue: Keishi Hattori

entry.title: Add |added_damage| to the unembedded render pass in Surface Aggregator.
entry.content:
|added_damage| calculated from the descendant render passes during

surface aggregation does not propagated to the root_damage_rect for

the unembedded render pass. Add it back to the unembedded render

pass when the nonroot damage rect is set.



The original cc damage included in the root damage is projected

from the root render pass back to the nonroot render pass.

Although this damage is clipped, it will be redrawn and the damage

will be recovered when this nonroot render pass is embedded again.

(|parent_clip_rect| will detect if redraw is needed.)

entry.title: graphite: Stop using bottom left origin for 2D canvas
entry.content:
Graphite won't support bottom left origin SkSurfaces or rendering. 2D

canvas contexts use bottom left origin when accelerated and not in low

latency mode. Change it to always use top left origin.



Similarly, OffscreenCanvas uses an intermediate CanvasResourceProvider

to render from the context to a resource that's exported to the

compositor. This rendering can sometimes use Skia (e.g. 2D canvas) for

which Graphite won't support bottom left origin destination.



Make OffscreenCanvas use top left origin for the intermediate CRP and

fix the plumbing to ensure the correct value is used when calling

DispatchFrame by exposing IsOriginTopLeft() on CanvasResource.

entry.title: [fix-swo-violations] Fix sort comparison function
entry.content:
The compare function assumes that its arguments do not alias the same

object. This assumption is used to check that names are unique.

However, this assumption is not guaranteed to hold by std::sort, and

the CHECK fails if _LIBCPP_DEBUG_STRICT_WEAK_ORDERING_CHECK is defined.

This CL gets rid of the assumption and only checks for uniqueness if

left-hand and right-hand sides of the compare function are different

objects.

entry.title: [fix-swo-violations] Fix sort comparison function
entry.content:
The CompareStates comparison function assumes that its arguments do not

alias the same object. This assumption is used to check that network

GUIDs are unique.

However, this assumption is not guaranteed to hold by std::sort, and

the DCHECK fails with _LIBCPP_DEBUG_STRICT_WEAK_ORDERING_CHECK defined.

This CL gets rid of the assumption and only checks for uniqueness if

left-hand and right-hand sides of the compare function are different

objects.

Also change >= to > to make sure the comparison function is a strict

weak ordering.



Bug: NOBUG

entry.title: Add field trial parameters for canvas 2d auto flushing
entry.content:
Adding a field trial flag with two parameters to control the max

op bytes and max pinned image bytes thresholds that are used to

trigger the automatic flushing of 2D canvas contexts. These parameters

will be used in an upcoming multi-arm Finch experiment to tune the

heuristic parameters.



This change does not modify the current default behaviour.

entry.title: FLEDGE: Make our handling of promises more consistent with the Web
entry.content:
Using Promise in WebIDL will auto-wrap things that are not already promises; and unlike our current code works properly with other then-able.



The downside is that auctionSignals/sellerSignals with 'then' fields will break, and it's somewhat less efficient.

entry.title: Move two params from NetworkContextParams to NetworkContextFilePaths.
entry.content:
This CL moves http_cache_directory and shared_dictionary_directory

to the NetworkContextFilePath struct. This is to keep all filepaths

consistently within the NetworkContextFilePaths.



For the most part there are no functional changes as these parameters already exist, the majority of the changes modify callers to make sure they set parameters correctly.



The only slight change is that MaybeGrantSandboxAccessToNetworkContextData() now checks if any file_paths exist in the beginning, and does a follow up check to see if data_directory is empty as there is now a possibility that the file_paths exist but the data_directory has not been set. The end result is the same, however, as the method still returns kDidNotAttemptToGrantSandboxAccess in these cases.



Bug: 1333558
